isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES60-5 - CLEAN AND INSPECT - INSPECT

svcsubproc.title: Clutch Gears
svcsubproc.para: Both the internal and external teeth must have sharp edges. Check for chipped or broken teeth, or teeth with rounded corners. Also examine fork slots for wear. Replace clutch gears if any of these conditions exist.

svcsubproc.title: Gears
svcsubproc.para: Examine for broken or cracked clutch teeth. Also check for any unusual wear patterns. If any of the preceding exists, replace the gear. If a gear must be replaced, also remember to replace its mating gear.

svcsubproc.title: Thrust Washers
svcsubproc.para: Check for flatness, excessive face wear, cracks, scoring, or signs of heat damage.

svcsubproc.title: Snap Rings
svcsubproc.para: New snap rings are recommended with every rebuild.

svcsubproc.title: Mainshaft
svcsubproc.para: Check for signs of twisting or misalignment, and for worn or damaged splines. Also inspect the shift bar support bracket for cracks or worn slots.

svcsubproc.title: Bearings
svcsubproc.para: New bearings are recommended with every rebuild.

svcsubproc.title: Housings
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the housing sections for cracks. If cracks exist, replace that section of the housing. Also inspect the shift bar support bracket for cracks or worn slots. Replace if either of these conditions exist.

important.para: REPAIR OR REPLACE WORN PARTS. Many times the parts or critical adjustments causing the trouble are not replaced or corrected because the mechanic only inspects and replaces parts that have failed completely. All pieces should be carefully examined because broken parts are often just the result-not the cause-of the problem. All parts that are broken or worn and no longer meet specifications should be replaced.
Also, parts that are worn to the extent that they do not have a long service life remaining should be replaced. Replacing these parts now will avoid another teardown of the unit in the near future.
